name: Hollowsage
text: Whenever Hollowsage becomes untapped, you may have target player discard a card.

editions.flavor: Dreams of dark nights to come are said to stir in the minds of scheming hollowsages.

name: Hollow Specter
text:
Flying
Whenever Hollow Specter deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {X}. If you do, that player reveals X cards from his or her hand and you choose one of them. That player discards that card.

name: Hollow Trees
text:
Hollow Trees enters the battlefield tapped.
You may choose not to untap Hollow Trees during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Hollow Trees is tapped, put a storage counter on it.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Hollow Trees: Add {G} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

name: Hollow Warrior
text: Hollow Warrior can't attack or block unless you tap an untapped creature you control not declared as an attacking or blocking creature this combat. (This cost is paid as attackers or blockers are declared.)

editions.flavor: Though it moves like a living thing, anyone can tell it lacks a soul—not to mention mercy.

name: Holy Armor
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
{W}: Enchanted creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

name: Holy Day
text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

editions.flavor:
"The day of Spirits; my soul's calm retreat / Which none disturb!"
—Henry Vaughan, "The Night"

"Will history remember this as the day demons arrived or the day saviors arrived?"
—Barrin

"The day of Spirits; my soul's calm retreat / Which none disturb"
—Henry Vaughan, "The Night"
"The day of spirits; my soul's clam retreat/ Which none disturb!" —Henry Vaughan, "Silex Scintillans"

"Today there is feasting and peace across our land, but the war has not ended. Tuck away your bloodlust. You'll need it tomorrow."
—Karrim, Samite healer

name: Holy Justiciar
text: {2}{W}, {T}: Tap target creature. If that creature is a Zombie, exile it.

editions.flavor: Her eyes see through the rotting flesh and glimpse a soul in agony, begging for the Blessed Sleep.

name: Holy Light
text: Nonwhite creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Bathed in hallowed light, the infidels looked upon the impurities of their souls and despaired." —The Book of Tal

"Bathed in hallowed light, the infidels looked upon the impurities of their souls and despaired."
—The Book of Tal

name: Holy Mantle
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has protection from creatures.

editions.flavor:
"The guilds promise to provide safety. I prefer to make my own."
—Briska, Ninth District freemage

name: Holy Strength
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.

editions.flavor: Such power protects the body with the strength of the soul.

"Born under the sun, the first child will seek the foundation of honor and be fortified by its righteousness."
—Codex of the Constellari

"Born under the sun, the first child will seek the foundation of honor and be fortified by its righteousness."
—Codex of the Constellari

"May angels fly at your back. May your blade cleave the darkness."
—War blessing of Serra

name: Homarid
text:
Homarid enters the battlefield with a tide counter on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a tide counter on Homarid.
As long as there is exactly one tide counter on Homarid, it gets -1/-1.
As long as there are exactly three tide counters on Homarid, it gets +1/+1.
Whenever there are four or more tide counters on Homarid, remove all tide counters from it.

name: Homarid Shaman
text: {U}: Tap target green creature.

editions.flavor:
"The ground grew swampy; hooves and claws sank into the marshy earth. Snarls of rage and bleats of despair echoed through the trees as the waters grew higher and higher."
—Kyliki of Havenwood,
"Havenwood Remembered"

name: Homarid Spawning Bed
text: {1}{U}{U}, Sacrifice a blue creature: Create X 1/1 blue Camarid creature tokens, where X is the sacrificed creature's converted mana cost.

name: Homarid Warrior
text: {U}: Homarid Warrior gains shroud until end of turn and doesn't untap during your next untap step. Tap Homarid Warrior. (A creature with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

name: Homeward Path
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Each player gains control of all creatures he or she owns.

editions.flavor:
"Let your heels point you home."
—Ancient blessing

"Let your heels point you home."
—Ancient blessing

"Let your heels point you home."
—Ancient blessing

name: Homicidal Brute
text: At the beginning of your end step, if Homicidal Brute didn't attack this turn, tap Homicidal Brute, then transform it.

editions.flavor: For a moment his basest desires run free, unshackled by reason or conscience.

name: Homicidal Seclusion
text: As long as you control exactly one creature, that creature gets +3/+1 and has lifelink.

editions.flavor:
"Damned crows and their endless squawking . . . blocks out the voices in my head . . ."
—Hermit of Hanne Hall

name: Homing Lightning
text: Homing Lightning deals 4 damage to target creature and each other creature with the same name as that creature.

editions.flavor:
"I see countless worlds. What makes them think I can't find them in just one?"
—Ral Zarek

name: Homing Sliver
text:
Each Sliver card in each player's hand has slivercycling {3}.
Slivercycling {3} ({3}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Sliver card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

name: Homura, Human Ascendant
text:
Homura, Human Ascendant can't block.
When Homura dies, return it to the battlefield flipped.

name: Homura's Essence
text: Creatures you control get +2/+2 and have flying and "{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."

name: Honden of Cleansing Fire
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain 2 life for each Shrine you control.

editions.flavor: To the sorrow of all, its fire was turned toward those who worshipped it.
To the sorrow of all, its fire was turned toward those who worshipped it.

name: Honden of Infinite Rage
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Honden of Infinite Rage deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of Shrines you control.

editions.flavor: To the sorrow of all, its rage became focused on those who once stoked it.
To the sorrow of all, its rage became focused on those who once stoked it.

name: Honden of Life's Web
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, create a 1/1 colorless Spirit creature token for each Shrine you control.

editions.flavor: To the sorrow of all, its web became a net that strangled those who helped weave it.
To the sorrow of all, its web became a net that strangled those who helped weave it.

name: Honden of Night's Reach
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent discards a card for each Shrine you control.

editions.flavor: To the sorrow of all, its dark reach grasped and crushed those who guarded its silent vigil.
To the sorrow of all, its dark reach grasped and crushed those who guarded its silent vigil.

name: Honden of Seeing Winds
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card for each Shrine you control.

editions.flavor: To the sorrow of all, its winds found sin in the hearts of those who once learned from its wisdom.
To the sorrow of all, its winds found sin in the hearts of those who once learned from its wisdom.

name: Honorable Passage
text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature or player this turn, prevent that damage. If damage from a red source is prevented this way, Honorable Passage deals that much damage to the source's controller.

name: Honorable Scout
text: When Honorable Scout enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life for each black and/or red creature target opponent controls.

editions.flavor: "I've faced your kind before. This time I'm ready for you."

name: Honored Hierarch
text:
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)
As long as Honored Hierarch is renowned, it has vigilance and "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

name: Honor Guard
text: {W}: Honor Guard gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The strength of one. The courage of ten.

"It is not a choice I make, to have this guard. It is the choice of my people, and my duty to them."
—Oracle en-Vec
The strength of one. The courage of ten.

"It is not a choice I make, to have this guard. It is the choice of my people, and my duty to them."
—Oracle en-Vec

name: Honor of the Pure
text: White creatures you control get +1/+1.

editions.flavor: Together the soldiers were like a golden blade, cutting down their enemies and scarring the darkness.
Together the soldiers were like a golden blade, cutting down their enemies and scarring the darkness.
Together the soldiers were like a golden blade, cutting down their enemies and scarring the darkness.
Together the soldiers were like a golden blade, cutting down their enemies and scarring the darkness.

name: Honor's Reward
text: You gain 4 life. Bolster 2. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put two +1/+1 counters on it.)

editions.flavor: It seldom rains in Abzan lands. When it does, the khan marks the occasion by honoring the families of the fallen.

name: Honor the Fallen
text: Exile all creature cards from all graveyards. You gain 1 life for each card exiled this way.

editions.flavor:
"May the River claim Cho-Manno's body, wherever it lies."
—Ta-Karnst, Cho-Arrim healer

name: Honor-Worn Shaku
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
Tap an untapped legendary permanent you control: Untap Honor-Worn Shaku.

editions.flavor: Before being presented to its lord, each shaku is blessed by every hero of every region within that lord's domain.

name: Hooded Assassin
text:
When Hooded Assassin enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Put a +1/+1 counter on Hooded Assassin.
• Destroy target creature that was dealt damage this turn.

name: Hooded Horror
text: Hooded Horror can't be blocked as long as defending player controls the most creatures or is tied for the most.

editions.flavor: Insidious fear can be the undoing of the greatest of armies.

name: Hooded Hydra
text:
Hooded Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
When Hooded Hydra dies, create a 1/1 green Snake creature token for each +1/+1 counter on it.
Morph {3}{G}{G}
As Hooded Hydra is turned face up, put five +1/+1 counters on it.

name: Hooded Kavu
text: {B}: Hooded Kavu gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

editions.flavor: The spread of its hood eclipses all hope.

name: Hoodwink
text: Return target artifact, enchantment, or land to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: The youths of Rishada's marketplace are always ready for a quick footrace.

name: Hoofprints of the Stag
text:
Whenever you draw a card, you may put a hoofprint counter on Hoofprints of the Stag.
{2}{W}, Remove four hoofprint counters from Hoofprints of the Stag: Create a 4/4 white Elemental creature token with flying. Activate this ability only during your turn.

name: Hoof Skulkin
text: {3}: Target green creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: It hunts with the memory of a long lost herd.

name: Hooting Mandrills
text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Trample

editions.flavor: Interlopers in Sultai territory usually end up as crocodile chow or baboon bait.

name: Hope Against Hope
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each creature you control.
As long as enchanted creature is a Human, it has first strike.

editions.flavor: "I have given my life to the church, my soul to Avacyn, and my heart to the people."

name: Hope and Glory
text: Untap two target creatures. Each of them gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Serra ruled by faith. I cannot afford that luxury."
—Radiant, archangel

name: Hope Charm
text:
Choose one —
• Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
• Target player gains 2 life.
• Destroy target Aura.

name: Hopeful Eidolon
text:
Bestow {3}{W} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has lifelink.

name: Hope of Ghirapur
text:
Flying
Sacrifice Hope of Ghirapur: Until your next turn, target player who was dealt combat damage by Hope of Ghirapur this turn can't cast noncreature spells.

editions.flavor: The renegades mounted an aether disruptor aboard a lightweight thopter to destroy Tezzeret's Planar Bridge.

name: Hopping Automaton
text: {0}: Hopping Automaton gets -1/-1 and gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Designed to carry equipment across rivers, the hopping automaton was soon pressed into service in the infantry.

name: Horde Ambusher
text:
Whenever Horde Ambusher blocks, it deals 1 damage to you.
Morph—Reveal a red card in your hand. (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Horde Ambusher is turned face up, target creature can't block this turn.

name: Hordeling Outburst
text: Create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.

editions.flavor: Kolaghan goblins rush into battle to satisfy their desire for violence as well as their desire not to be eaten.

"Leave no scraps, lest you attract pests."
—Mardu threat

name: Horde of Boggarts
text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Horde of Boggarts's power and toughness are each equal to the number of red permanents you control.

editions.flavor: Strategies don't come easily to the boggarts' feral minds, but full-on assault hasn't failed them yet.

name: Horde of Notions
text:
Vigilance, trample, haste
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}: You may play target Elemental card from your graveyard without paying its mana cost.

editions.flavor: Even the oldest treefolk was but an acorn when Lorwyn's first mysteries were born.
Even the oldest treefolk was but an acorn when Lorwyn's first mysteries were born.

name: Horizon Boughs
text:
All permanents untap during each player's untap step.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, you may search your library for up to three basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

name: Horizon Canopy
text:
{T}, Pay 1 life: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Horizon Canopy: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: The great leaves are resilient underfoot. Heavy steps do not bruise them, but release a sweet and spicy scent.

name: Horizon Chimera
text:
Flash
Flying, trample
Whenever you draw a card, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"Do not try to make sense of the chimera. Impossibility is its habitat."
—Kydele, prophet of Kruphix

name: Horizon Drake
text: Flying, protection from lands

editions.flavor: Using thermal updrafts and gravity currents, drakes eat and sleep in the air. Some never touch the ground from birth until death.

name: Horizon Scholar
text:
Flying
When Horizon Scholar enters the battlefield, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

name: Horizon Seed
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, regenerate target creature.

editions.flavor: In peaceful times, these beings escorted the honored kami to their new shrines. In the Kami War, they became the medics of an unstoppable army.

name: Horizon Spellbomb
text:
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice Horizon Spellbomb: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
When Horizon Spellbomb is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {G}. If you do, draw a card.

name: Horncaller's Chant
text: Create a 4/4 green Rhino creature token with trample, then populate. (Create a token that's a copy of a creature token you control.)

editions.flavor:
"The Selesnya are gathering armies. Do you still believe they aren't preparing for war?"
—Teysa, to Isperia

name: Horned Cheetah
text: Whenever Horned Cheetah deals damage, you gain that much life.

editions.flavor: "I think she wants us to eat it," said Squee, staring at the oily carcass the cheetah had dragged to their fire.

name: Horned Helm
text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 and has trample.
{G}{G}: Attach Horned Helm to target creature you control.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Horned Kavu
text: When Horned Kavu enters the battlefield, return a red or green creature you control to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: "That didn't happen naturally," said Multani. "Rath's overlay is interfering with the Æther itself."

name: Horned Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have trample.

editions.flavor: A bristling wave of slivers broke against the Weatherlight's timbers.
A bristling wave of slivers broke against the Weatherlight's timbers.

name: Horned Troll
text: {G}: Regenerate Horned Troll.

editions.flavor:
"If I says it's a troll, it's a troll. Goblins is always right in Mercadia."
—Squee
Sword hilts jut from some trolls' bodies where wounds healed so fast that the weapons were trapped inside.
It doesn't like having visitors . . . unless it's having them for lunch.

"So like men are they: a hardened shell with fragile flesh beneath."
—Selenia, dark angel

"So like men are they: a hardened shell with fragile flesh beneath."
—Selenia, dark angel

"So like men are they: a hardened shell with fragile flesh beneath."
—Selenia, dark angel
It doesn't like having visitors . . . unless it's having them for lunch.
Its spear has no shaft, its shield no handle.
It's a mistake to say turtles hide in their shells. They merely need time to contemplate how best to bite your head off.

text: Flying, haste

name: Hornet Cobra
text: First strike

editions.flavor: "Then inch by inch out of the grass rose up the head and spread hood of Nag, the big black cobra, and he was five feet long from tongue to tail." —Rudyard Kipling, The Jungle Books

name: Hornet Harasser
text: When Hornet Harasser dies, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"And though she didn't get her honey, Auntie found something far more interesting."
—A tale of Auntie Grub

name: Hornet Nest
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Hornet Nest is dealt damage, create that many 1/1 green Insect creature tokens with flying and deathtouch. (Any amount of damage a creature with deathtouch deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

name: Hornet Queen
text:
Flying
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
When Hornet Queen enters the battlefield, create four 1/1 green Insect creature tokens with flying and deathtouch.

name: Hornet Sting
text: Hornet Sting deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: It was only then—to his infinite sorrow—that Gork realized hornets don't make honey.

name: Horn of Deafening
text: {2}, {T}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target creature this turn.

editions.flavor: "A blast, an echo . . . then silence."
"A blast, an echo . . . then silence."
"A blast, an echo . . . then silence."

name: Horn of Greed
text: Whenever a player plays a land, that player draws a card.

editions.flavor:
"Rath grows, and I am nourished."
—Volrath

"Rath grows, and I am nourished."
—Volrath

name: Horn of Plenty
text: Whenever a player casts a spell, he or she may pay {1}. If that player does, he or she draws a card at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor:
"This horn is an exact replica of the fabled Horn of Ramos, except mine is more lavish."
—Mercadian magistrate

name: Horn of Ramos
text:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
Sacrifice Horn of Ramos: Add {G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Ramos touched, and there was life.

name: Horobi, Death's Wail
text:
Flying
Whenever a creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, destroy that creature.

editions.flavor:
"From the ashes of Reito rose a new kami. And thereafter at every battle came Horobi, Death's Wail."
—The History of Kamigawa

name: Horobi's Whisper
text:
If you control a Swamp, destroy target nonblack creature.
Splice onto Arcane—Exile four cards from your graveyard. (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

name: Horrible Hordes
text: Rampage 1 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)

editions.flavor: Few are able to underestimate the hordes.

name: Horribly Awry
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
Counter target creature spell with converted mana cost 4 or less. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.

editions.flavor: "We are nothing but dust to them—our bodies, our actions, even our words."—Jori En, expedition leader

name: Horrifying Revelation
text: Target player discards a card, then puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"Ours is a glorious transmission! Behold a future where all bow to the Father of Machines."
—Isila, Priest of Sheoldred

name: Horror of Horrors
text: Sacrifice a Swamp: Regenerate target black creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

editions.flavor:
"And a horror of outer darkness after,/
And dust returneth to dust again." —Adam Lindsay Gordon, The Swimmer

name: Horror of the Dim
text: {U}: Horror of the Dim gains hexproof until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

editions.flavor:
"Lesser minds can scarcely imagine such a marriage of necromancy and mind magic."
—Strava, Dimir mage

name: Horseshoe Crab
text: {U}: Untap Horseshoe Crab.

editions.flavor:
"Hmm . . . It looks kinda like a bug. Let's crack it open an' see if it tastes like one!"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand
In the final days before the disaster, all the crabs on Tolaria migrated from inlets, streams, and ponds back to the sea. No one took note.

name: Hostile Realm
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Target creature can't block this turn."

editions.flavor: Lorwyn's crust explodes with power when the greater elementals are born. The flamekin use the fallout as cover for forays into enemy territory.

name: Hostility
text:
Haste
If a spell you control would deal damage to an opponent, prevent that damage. Create a 3/1 red Elemental Shaman creature token with haste for each 1 damage prevented this way.
When Hostility is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

name: Hotheaded Giant
text:
Haste
Hotheaded Giant enters the battlefield with two -1/-1 counters on it unless you've cast another red spell this turn.

editions.flavor: As he races the moon each night, he draws a glowing equator across the world.

name: Hot Soup
text:
Equipped creature can't be blocked.
Whenever equipped creature is dealt damage, destroy it.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

editions.flavor:
"Comin' through!"
Designed by James Ernest

name: Hot Springs
text:
Enchant land you control
Enchanted land has "{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn."

editions.flavor: Warmth is life; heat is peace.

name: Hound of Griselbrand
text:
Double strike
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

name: Hound of the Farbogs
text: Delirium — Hound of the Farbogs has menace as long as there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard. (A creature with menace can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

editions.flavor: As you hear it baying in the distance, you'll feel its breath on your neck.

name: Hour of Need
text:
Strive — Hour of Need costs {1}{U} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Exile any number of target creatures. For each creature exiled this way, its controller creates a 4/4 blue Sphinx creature token with flying.

name: Hour of Reckoning
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Destroy all nontoken creatures.

editions.flavor:
"Ravnica, like a hedge, must be pruned, leaving only leaves of verdant uniformity."
—Niszka, Selesnya evangel

"Ravnica, like a hedge, must be pruned, leaving only leaves of verdant uniformity."
—Niszka, Selesnya evangel

name: Hover Barrier
text: Defender, flying

editions.flavor: As whispers and rumors increased, so did the demand for fail-safe barriers.

name: Hoverguard Observer
text:
Flying
Hoverguard Observer can block only creatures with flying.

editions.flavor: It could be made to run silently, but its low hum reminds the Neurok that they are always watched.

name: Hoverguard Sweepers
text:
Flying
When Hoverguard Sweepers enters the battlefield, you may return up to two target creatures to their owners' hands.

editions.flavor: They only appear in emergencies, and emergencies never last long.
They only appear in emergencies, and emergencies never last long.

name: Hovermyr
text: Flying, vigilance

editions.flavor: Originally created to harvest blinkmoths, the hovermyr are now the silent observers of a dying world.

name: Howl from Beyond
text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Whether it howls for hunger or for joy, you're in trouble just the same.

"From the mouths of my servants, my voice shall emerge to shake the souls of my foes."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Howlgeist
text:
Creatures with power less than Howlgeist's power can't block it.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
